description:
Shirokuma Cafe revolves around a Canadian white bear that quits his boring job and starts a cafeteria near a zoo. He loves telling tall tales and always brags about himself. According to him, he was picked up by a human couple who owns a diner while he was drifting around on an iceberg.

Though he has lost all contact with his Canadian family, he has discovered a new home in serving the diners' clientele, thanks to the kind couple. His café is an embodiment of his personality. The place is always packed with many regulars, animals and humans, who are drawn by his charismatic magnetism.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

__Tooru Hosokawa__ is a Japanese director, series composer and script/screenwriter.

A Japanese musician, lyricist, composer, arranger and the bandmaster of [Clammbon](https://anilist.co/staff/114171/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4006951) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/micromicrophone/)

A Japanese musician, lyricist, composer, arranger and the bandmaster of [Clammbon](https://anilist.co/staff/114171/).

[Website](http://www.clammbon.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ClammbonChannel)

A Japanese three-member band.

Originally formed in 1996 when the three members were students of the jazz department at college. They made their major label debut on Warner Music Japan three years later. Their music is characterized by their quirky sound combining jazzy chord progressions with J-pop and electronica influences.

The band's name comes from a fictional character in the [Kenji Miyazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105101/) novel *Yamanashi.*

**Members:**
- [Mito](https://anilist.co/staff/133408/) - bandmaster, bassist
- [Ikuko Harada](https://anilist.co/staff/274097/) - vocalist, keyboardist
- Daisuke Itou - drummer

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4006951) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/micromicrophone/)

A Japanese musician, lyricist, composer, arranger and the bandmaster of [Clammbon](https://anilist.co/staff/114171/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/65924904) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/Riefuofficial) | [Website](https://riefu.com/)

Rie Fu was born in Tokyo, Japan, but later moved to Maryland in 1992 until 1995. While there she acquired piano lessons and inspiration. She then moved back to Japan to complete her secondary education and in July of 2007 she went on to graduate from the Central Saint Martins college of the University of the Arts London. Being a student there, she studied Fine Art Painting and now does most of the art for, and in, her albums. After learning guitar she soon began writing songs. One, Life is Like a Boat, became the ending theme for Bleach.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/65924904) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/Riefuofficial) | [Website](https://riefu.com/)

Rie Fu was born in Tokyo, Japan, but later moved to Maryland in 1992 until 1995. While there she acquired piano lessons and inspiration. She then moved back to Japan to complete her secondary education and in July of 2007 she went on to graduate from the Central Saint Martins college of the University of the Arts London. Being a student there, she studied Fine Art Painting and now does most of the art for, and in, her albums. After learning guitar she soon began writing songs. One, Life is Like a Boat, became the ending theme for Bleach.
